newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: N.Korea hands over U.S. remains at Korean border.
newsitem.headline: N.Korea hands over U.S. remains at Korean border.

text.p: North Korea on Monday handed over the remains of four U.S. soldiers killed during the 1950-1953 Korean War, an apparent goodwill gesture on the eve of landmark four-nation talks, witnesses said.
At the tense Korean border, North Korean officers delivered four coffins draped in United Nations flags to representatives of the U.S.-led United Nations Command.
The repatriation of the remains comes as the two Koreas, the United States and China prepared for a meeting on Tuesday in New York aimed at setting a date, venue and agenda for their peace talks.
The talks are aimed at hammering out a permanent peace mechanism on the Korean peninsula, the last Cold War flashpoint, to replace the 1953 armistice that ended the Korean War.
The United State backed the capitalist South during the war and China the communist North.
A team of 10 U.S. experts has been searching in North Korea since mid-July for remains of Americans missing in action from the war.
